title: Chalice Cover, 16th–17th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic thread
Technique: satin stitch embroidery
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous Donor
description: Faded purple ribbed silk ground embroidered in colored silk and metallic thread. Central design shows a cruciform composed of conventionalized flowerheads in profile and S-forms of foliage. Cover design of symmetrical delicately curving vine and flower. Narrow border of similar small scale design. Red, pale green and peach-colored silks.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chalice Cover, 16th–17th century.Medium: silk, metallic thread
Technique: satin stitch embroidery. Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous Donor. 1949-64-17.
